content:
So you are on a public forum asking volunteers for your password. Think about that for a moment.

Then do you men this https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb or this https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password or even what this web site password stored in edge is. I can only guess and suggest no one but you have access to your passwords.

content: Is framside an email provider? A website? You need to contact them to reset it. The password belongs to you and is used by you to get in to 'framside' - Thunderbird only uses what you give it.
creator: arlev

content: Under Settings/General/Files and Attachments is there a line for jpg? A similar question and answer appears here - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1403250 You can search for similar problems using the search window at the top before posting questions.
creator: arlev

content: Is this popping up when you try to connect to a server to retrieve email? This is IMAP? Is this a new account? TB is warning you that the server that you are trying to connect to does not hold a valid security certificate - which would be a little strange considering it's Outlook and the server address looks okay. Have you cancelled out and retried connecting?
creator: arlev

content:
You can set up an address book - if you haven't already - and then tell TB to send all the emails from those correspondents into a specific folder. The ones that arrive in the Inbox should then be *mostly* spam. Go to the Three lines (top right)/Tools/Message Filters to set one up.

I would imagine that the unwanted emails are never from the same source so training TB to recognise them as junk won't be very helpful. But it might be worth trying for a while.

You didn't say which email provider you use. Many have their own kill-filters which could be set up if something in the emails is distinctive and recurring (or else some of the genuine ones would be kill-filed).

You could also get a new email address and migrate your correspondents over with time. But that's a bit of a faff.
creator: arlev

content: A simple filter might also do this, since you indicate you receive from same ones
